P002030.project_name: East Central State Oil Palm Project

keywords.cdata: Agricultural Investment,Agriculture,alluvium,ammonia,cassava,clay,clays,climatic conditions,Cocoa,cooperatives,Crop,Cropping,Cropping Patterns,Cultivation,Cultivation Techniques,cut off,drainage,dry season,dust,earth,evapotranspiration,Export,FAO,Farm,Farm Incomes,farmer,Farmers,Farming,Farming Systems,farms,ferns,fertilizer,fertilizers,food crops,forest soils,fresh fruit,germinated seed,Germination,Harvesting,inoculum,Land Tenure,land use,Leaf Spot,leaves,lines,loams,magnesium,maize,mapping,Natural Resources,nitrogen,nurseries,nutrients,Oil Palm,Palm Oil,palms,Plant Breeding,Plant Production,Planting,Produce,programs,Pruning,radiation,rain,Rainfall,rainy season,replanting,rivers,roots,sand,sandy soils,Seed,Seed production,seed treatment,seedlings,seeds,Shading,silt,soil,soil analysis,soil classification,soil moisture,soil samples,soil surveys,soil water,Soils,sowing,spacing,sprinkler irrigation,streams,Temperature,top soil,topography,transplanting,vegetation,water,water consumption,Water Deficits,water requirements,weeds,West,West Africa,Wilt,winds,yams,Yields

project_abstract.cdata: The Mid Western States Oil Palm Project will be carried out over a nine-year investment period 1975 through 1983 and will involve: establishing an Oil Palm Division of the Tree Crop Unit created at Benin under the second Cocoa loan to implement the replanting program; new planting/replanting of 8,000 ha of smallholder oil palm and 8,000 ha of nucleus oil palm estates; improving about 299 km of earthroads to facilitate all-weather collection of ffb from smallholders; operating a grant/credit scheme for smallholders; training staff and farmers at selected institutions and through in-service courses; the construction and operation of two palm oil mills by Oil Palm Company (OPC) to process the total production from the estates and smallholders; establishing a fruit collection system to be operated by OPC for estate and smallholder production; establishing under the Federal Department of Agriculture a Monitoring and Evaluation Unit (MEU) with a Tree Crop Section at Benin; initiating field studies of small-scale processing for wild palm grove production. The East Central State Oil Palm Project will be carried out over a nine-year investment period 1975 through 1983 and will involve: establishing a Smallholder Management Unit within the Ministry of Agricultural Production and Animal Husbandry to implement the replanting program; replanting 16,000 ha of smallholder wild palm groves; improving about 571 km of earth roads to facilitate all-weather collection of fresh fruit bunches from smallholders; operating a grant/credit scheme for smallholders; training staff and farmers at selected institutions and through in-service courses; the construction and operation of the oil palm mills by the Agricultural Development Authority to process the fruit produced by the project smallholdings; establishing a fruit collection system to be operated by ADA for smallholder production.
